page.title: 12DEVELOPMENT IN CHERRY WALK
page.content: Developers who want to demolish two imposing houses on land near Cherry Walk,High Salvington,and replacs them with a housing estate,have taken their plan to appeal. Hadley and Appledore are two large detatched houses set in more than three acres of attractive gardens. A Surrey building company applied to knock them down and put up 22 two-storey detatched houses with garages.The scheme aroused a storm of protest from residents of the area, especially those around West Way, which would become the access road for the new estate. Worthing Borough Council planners refused permission because they felt the building plan was too intensive,but have warned that they would not be able to resist a more modest application.
